metadata.feature_description: Automatically filter and moderate profane content in posts and comments

steps.action: Navigate to Persona Bar > Settings > Community
steps.expected: Community settings page loads with profanity filter options
steps.actual: Community settings page loaded successfully with Profanity Filtering dropdown visible
Dropdown expanded showing three options: Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering
Prohibit Content option was selected successfully
Settings saved successfully with confirmation message

steps.action: Navigate to Community Activity Stream page
steps.expected: Activity Stream page loads with post input area
steps.actual: Activity Stream page loaded successfully with 'Tell the world something' input area visible

steps.action: Enter text containing profane word 'damn' in the post input
steps.expected: Text is entered in the post input field
steps.actual: Text 'Testing profanity filter with word damn' entered successfully

steps.action: Click Share button to submit the post
steps.expected: Post should be blocked with error message since Prohibit Content is enabled
steps.actual: Post was accepted and published without being blocked. The profane content 'damn' was not filtered or prohibited.

issues: Profanity filter set to 'Prohibit Content' did not block post containing the word 'damn'. The post was accepted and displayed in the activity stream. This indicates either the profanity word list is empty/not configured, or the filter is not functioning correctly.

steps.action: Navigate to Host > Lists to configure profanity word list
steps.expected: Lists management page loads showing available lists including ProfanityFilter
steps.actual: No UI found to configure the profanity word list. The Host/Lists page shows Host options but no Lists management interface. Persona Bar does not expose the Lists configuration.

issues: No accessible UI found to configure the profanity word list (ProfanityFilter list in DNN ListController). Based on code review, the profanity filter relies on the ListController 'ProfanityFilter' list, but there is no visible UI in Persona Bar or legacy admin pages to manage this list.

steps.action: Verify profanity filter dropdown options in Community Settings
steps.expected: Three filter levels should be available: Filter Content, Prohibit Content, No Filtering
steps.actual: All three filter levels are available in the dropdown: Filter Content (default), Prohibit Content, and No Filtering

observations: Code review confirmed three profanity filter modes exist: FilterContent (0) - replaces profane words, ProhibitContent (1) - blocks submission entirely, NoFiltering (2) - no filtering applied
The profanity filter implementation in ActivityStreamServicesController.cs correctly checks the filter setting and uses ProfanityHelper.ContainsProfanity() for validation
ProfanityHelper.cs uses PortalSecurity.Instance.Remove() with 'ProfanityFilter' ListController list to detect profanity
The profanity word list is stored in DNN's ListController under the key 'ProfanityFilter', but this list appears to be empty or not configured by default
No UI was found in Persona Bar or legacy admin pages to manage the profanity word list - this is a critical missing feature for the profanity filter to function
The suggested test scenario 'Admin > Activity Stream Settings > Profanity Filter' location in the prompt is incorrect - the actual location is Persona Bar > Settings > Community
